article.headline: Biden holds 15-point lead over Trump in new national poll
article.body: Former Vice President Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump by 15 points in a new national poll of registered voters focused on November's presidential election. The survey from Quinnipiac University shows Biden with 52% support vs. Trump's 37%, marking his biggest lead so far in the university's polls. The Quinnipiac survey was conducted from last Thursday to Monday and has a margin of error of plus or minus 2.8 percentage points. In a RealClearPolitics moving average of national polls, Biden leads Trump by 8.1 points.
